cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 mi WNW of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: continues WNW across Hispaniola and Cuba, then turns northwest into the central-northwestern Gulf of Mexico toward the upper TX / southwest LA coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana or the upper Texas–Louisiana border area

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for the Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for the Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast through south-central Louisiana
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Likely (4–6 inches possible if the track shifts slightly west)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (3–5 ft inundation possible on upper TX coast if storm tracks nearer)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–50 mph) are possible with higher gusts if the center comes closer to the upper Texas coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor to moderate coastal flooding and 3–5 ft surge possible, especially around high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could produce 4–6 inches with locally higher totals, leading to flash-flooding in low-lying port areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas, dangerous rip currents, and long-period swells could disrupt vessel traffic and cargo operations before and after closest approach.
